intro: Terminalia guaiquinimae var. steyermarkii, commonly known as the Guaiquinimae Steyermarkii Terminalia, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its deciduous nature, shedding its leaves during the dry season. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
